testsuite.name: Pages open properly
testsuite.details: This test suite is responsible for the proper opening pages.

testcase.name: Home page opens properly

step.expectedresults:
Page loading time is short enough

'Home' page displays properly as on attached screenshot

testcase.name: Login page opens properly

step.expectedresults:
Page loading time is short enough

'Login' page displays properly as on attached screenshot

testcase.name: Market page opens properly

step.expectedresults:
Page loading time is short enough

'Market' page displays properly as on attached screenshot

testcase.name: Workshop page opens properly

step.expectedresults:
Page loading time is short enough

'Workshop' page displays properly as on attached screenshot

testcase.name: About page opens properly

step.expectedresults:
Page loading time is short enough

'About' page displays properly as on attached screenshot

testcase.name: Support page opens properly

step.expectedresults:
Page loading time is short enough

'Support' page displays properly as on attached screenshot

testcase.name: Community market displays 10 most popular items

step.expectedresults: List expands with home, discussions, workshop, market and broadcast options.

'Market' page opens properly

10 most popular items are displayed with details:

1. Item photo

2. Name of item

3. Name of game

4. Quantity

5. Price

testcase.name: Community market displays 10 newly listed items

step.expectedresults: List expands with home, discussions, workshop, market and broadcast options.

List displays 10 results of newest items with details:

1. Item photo

2. Item name

3. Game name

4. Seller avatar

5. Price

testcase.name: Community market displays 10 recently sold items

step.expectedresults: List expands with home, discussions, workshop, market and broadcast options.

List displays 10 results of newest items with details:

1. Item photo

2. Item name

3. Game name

4. Seller avatar

5. Price

testsuite.name: User is not logged in
testsuite.details: Shows community market behaviour if user is not logged in

testcase.name: Header is displayed properly with user NOT logged in
testcase.preconditions: User is NOT logged in

step.expectedresults:
'Market' page opens properly

Displayed are:

1. Steam logo

2. Menu options:

'Store',

'Community',

'About',

'Support'

3. 'Install Steam' button

4. 'login' button

5. 'language' button

testcase.name: My Active Listings displays proper data
testcase.preconditions: User is NOT logged in

step.expectedresults:
'Market' page opens properly

"My Active Listings' section displays text: 'Login to see, edit, or remove your Community Market listings

testcase.name: My Market History displays proper data
testcase.preconditions: User is NOT logged in

step.expectedresults: "My Market History' section displays text: 'Login to view your Community Market history'

testcase.name: Sell an item option displays proper info
testcase.preconditions: User is NOT logged in

step.expectedresults:
Announcement displays with info: "You need to sign in or create an account to do that.'

Three buttons are visible: 'Sign In' , 'Create an Account' , 'Cancel'

testcase.name: Community Market banner is displayed
testcase.preconditions: User is NOT logged in

step.expectedresults:
'Market' page opens properly

Community Market banner is displayed under header with:

1. 'Community Market' writing

2. 'Buy and sell items with community members for Steam Wallet funds.' writing

3. Background is green

testsuite.name: User is logged in
testsuite.details: Shows community market behaviour if user is logged in.

testcase.name: Proper announcement if user is not selling any items now
testcase.preconditions:
User is already logged in

User does not have any items put on sale

step.expectedresults:
'Market' page opens properly

'My Active Listings' section displays another section 'My sell listings'

'My sell listings' section contains text 'You are not selling any items on the Community Market. Sell items from your inventory or click the 'Sell an item' button above.'

testcase.name: Proper announcement if user didn't make any buy order
testcase.preconditions:
User is already logged in

User does not have any buy orders

step.expectedresults:
'Market' page opens properly

'My Active Listings' section displays another section 'My buy orders'

'My buy orders' section displays text 'You do not have any buy orders.'

testcase.name: Items for sale are listed under My sell listings
testcase.preconditions:
User is already logged in

User already put item for sale

step.expectedresults:
'Market' page opens properly

'My Active Listings' section displays another section 'My sell listings'

'My buy orders' section displays items put on sale with details:

1. Item photo

2. Item name

3. Game name

4. Date (day and month)

5. Gross and net price

6. 'Remove' button

testcase.name: Buy orders are listed under My buy orders
testcase.preconditions:
User is already logged in

User already created at least 1 buy order

step.expectedresults:
'Market' page opens properly

'My Active Listings' section displays another section 'My buy orders'

'My buy orders' section displays buy ordered items list with details:

1. Item photo

2. Item name

3. Game name

4. Quantity

5. Price

6. 'Cancel' button

testcase.name: Header is displayed properly with user logged in
testcase.preconditions: User is already logged in

step.expectedresults:
'Market' page opens properly

Displayed are:

1. Steam logo

2. Menu options:

'Store',

'Community',

Username,

'Chat',

'Support'

3. 'Install Steam' button

4. Envelope icon

5. Nickname

6. Avatar

7. Account balance

testcase.name: Market history lists sold/bought items
testcase.preconditions:
User is already logged in

User sold/bought some items before

step.expectedresults:
Section with market history is displayed with every items details:

1. Char column (empty is possible if item was just created/canceled)

2. Item photo

3. Item name

4. Game name

5. Listed date

6. Acted date

7. With field

8. Price

testcase.name: Community Market banner is displayed with user logged in
testcase.preconditions: User is already logged in

step.expectedresults:
'Market' page opens properly

Community Market banner is displayed under header with:

1. 'Community Market' writing

2. 'Buy and sell items with community members for Steam Wallet funds.' writing

3. Background is green

4. User avatar

5. Wallet balance

6. 'View Inventory' button

testsuite.name: My Market History details
testsuite.details: This test suite verifies proper behavior of listed items infos

testcase.name: Created sell offer is displayed in market history
testcase.preconditions:
User is already logged in

User already created sell offer

step.expectedresults: Market history items history is listed properly

Properly listed sold item contains:

1. Char field is empty

2. Item acted date is empty

3. With column: 'Listing created'

4. Price

testcase.name: Sold item is displayed in market history
testcase.preconditions:
User is already logged in

User already sold any item

step.expectedresults: Market history items history is listed properly

Properly listed sold item contains:

1. ' - ' char

2. Item acted date

3. Buyer nickname and avatar

4. Price

testcase.name: Bought item is displayed in market history
testcase.preconditions:
User is already logged in

User already bought any item

step.expectedresults: Market history items history is listed properly

Properly listed bought item contains:

1. ' + ' char

2. Item acted date

3. Seller nickname and avatar

4. Price

testcase.name: Canceled sell offer is displayed in market history
testcase.preconditions:
User is already logged in

User already canceled any sell offer

step.expectedresults: Market history items history is listed properly

Properly listed sold item contains:

1. Char field is empty

2. Item acted date

3. With column: 'Listing canceled'

4. Price field is empty

testcase.name: Remove multiple search filter

step.expectedresults:
Selected filters are displayed

Listed items are related to selected filters

All filters are removed

Listed items originate from various games

testcase.name: Browse by game filters in advanced options

step.expectedresults:
Selected filters are displayed

Listed items are related to selected filters

testcase.name: Search and browse element is displayed properly

step.expectedresults:
'Market' page opens properly

Displayed are:

1. 'Read about security requirements (button) for using the Community Market'

2. Search module:

'Search for items' with search browser 

'Show advanced options' button

'Browse by Game' with 10 games listed

'Show more' button

testcase.name: Browse by listed game in market main page

step.expectedresults:
Displayed is writing 'Showing results for: <game name>'

Every listed element originates from selected game (contains game name)

testcase.name: Remove single search filter
Browse by listed game in advanced options

step.expectedresults:
Displayed is writing 'Showing results for: <game name>'

Every listed element originates from selected game (contains game name)

testcase.name: Reset selected filters in advanced options
Search by item description

step.actions:
Provide some description in 'Search' field

Optionally: select any game

testcase.name: See all option works properly

step.expectedresults:
'Market' page opens properly

'See all' button is visible under items list

Displayed are:

- items list

- results count

- page changer

testcase.name: Show more games option expands list

step.expectedresults:
'Market' page opens properly

'Show more' button is displayed under games list

testcase.name: Change page using left arrow button

step.expectedresults:
'Market' page opens properly

'See all' button is visible under items list

Displayed are:

- items list

- results count

- page changer

- first page chosen by default

- disabled LEFT ARROW BUTTON

testcase.name: Change page using right arrow button

step.expectedresults:
'Market' page opens properly

'See all' button is visible under items list

Displayed are:

- items list

- results count

- page changer

- first page chosen by default

- disabled LEFT ARROW BUTTON

testcase.name: Buy item from community market
testcase.preconditions:
User is already logged in

User have enough wallet balance

step.actions:
Search for an item, for example type in search engine: 

'Sticker | Spinx | Rio 2022'
Select an item you are interested in
step.expectedresults: User is redirected to selected item details page

step.actions: Insert correct data, check 'I agree to the terms [...]' and click 'Place order'
step.expectedresults:
Announcement about succeeded purchase is displayed

Wallet balance is reduced of bought item price

User is redirected to his inventory

User is able to see bought item in his inventory

testcase.name: Selling an item through market
testcase.preconditions:
User is already logged in

User have an item that is available to sell

step.expectedresults: 'Put an item for sale' box is displayed

step.actions: Set sell price, check agreement and click 'OK, put it up for sale' button
Close inventory by clicking 'x' in the right top
step.expectedresults: User is able to see item on 'My sell listings'

testsuite.name: Login
testsuite.details: This test suite describes tests used to check log in functionality

testcase.name: Login with credentials and code
testcase.preconditions: User has already installed, configured and set the steam mobile app.

step.expectedresults:
Login site opens properly

All login fields are displayed properly
Field with space to provide code is displayed

testcase.name: Login with credentials and approve button
testcase.preconditions: User has already installed, configured and set the steam mobile app.

step.expectedresults:
Login site opens properly

All login fields are displayed properly

step.actions: Accept login request in steam mobile app via 'Approve' button

testcase.name: Login via QR code
testcase.preconditions: User has already installed, configured and set the steam mobile app.

step.expectedresults:
Login site opens properly

All login fields are displayed properly

step.actions: Scan displayed QR Code with steam mobile app
step.expectedresults: 'Loading' animation is displayed on QR code

step.actions: Accept login request by clicking 'Sign in to Steam' button on steam mobile app

testcase.name: Login with wrong credentials

step.expectedresults:
Login site opens properly

All login fields are displayed properly
Announcement about wrong credentials provided is displayed

testcase.name: Invalid code provided
testcase.preconditions: User has already installed, configured and set the steam mobile app.

step.expectedresults:
Login site opens properly

All login fields are displayed properly
Field with space to provide code is displayed

testcase.name: Deny login request
testcase.preconditions: User has already installed, configured and set the steam mobile app.

step.expectedresults:
Login site opens properly

All login fields are displayed properly

step.actions: Deny login request by clicking 'Deny' on mobile steam app
step.expectedresults: Announcement about login request expiration is displayed

testcase.name: Cancel login by QR code
testcase.preconditions: User has already installed, configured and set the steam mobile app.

step.expectedresults:
Login site opens properly

All login fields are displayed properly

step.actions: Scan displayed QR Code with steam mobile app
step.expectedresults: 'Loading' animation is displayed on QR code

step.actions: Cancel login request by clicking 'Cancel' on steam mobile app
step.expectedresults:
User has not been logged in

'Loading' animation stopped

Retry button is displayed

testcase.name: Remember login credentials

step.expectedresults:
Login site opens properly

All login fields are displayed properly
User is logged in and redirected to home page

step.actions: Save login credentials using displayed browser popup announcement
Click on your nickname in the right top and Logout

step.expectedresults:
Login page is displayed

Correct credentials are already inserted

testcase.name: Proper redirection after logging in

step.actions:
1. Open any subpage, where you are asked to login, for example steam market item detail (buy/sell button) and click 'Login' or 'Sign in'

https://steamcommunity.com/market/listings/730/Recoil%20Case

step.expectedresults:
User is logged in

User is redirected to page, where has been asked to login
